newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Prince Charles heads for Hong Kong handover.
newsitem.headline: Prince Charles heads for Hong Kong handover.

text.p: Britain's heir to the throne Prince Charles flew into Hong Kong on Saturday from London for Monday's handover of the British colony to China.
The prince arrived aboard a chartered British Airways 747 jetliner which carried 200 members of Britain's delegation to the handover ceremonies.
Among those travelling with the prince were Foreign Secretary Robin Cook, former prime minister Edward Heath and former foreign secretary Lord (Geoffrey) Howe.

The prince, representing his mother, head of state Queen Elizabeth, will formally hand back the territory to Chinese President Jiang Zemin. He will then sail home on the royal yacht Britannia with governor Chris Patten.
The prince was driven from the airport to the Britannia, which is anchored in Victoria Harbour, within sight of the futuristic conference centre where the handover will take place.
